subject: Re: Share your stories for the press...?
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
I agree, W!  I asked one of my communicators the other night what kind
of being he considered himself to be.  The answer was, "Ex-human."  I
took that to mean a person who was formally in a physical body but is
no longer. But who knows!?! 

I do believe that our loved ones and other person's no longer residing
in the physical world can come through.  I'm also fascinated with the
idea of, as you mention, multiverses (reminds me of Drake's Equation)
and I'm open to the possibility that other physical beings are somehow
communicating with us.  

There's just so much that we simply do not know or understand.  What's
the old saying, "You don't know what you don't know."  LOL.

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, black bear hollow
<blackbearhollow@...> wrote:
>
> Ditto to all you said Margaret, and I'll further add that many times  
> people
> record all sorts of voices that we would consider "non-human". I'm not  
> sure why people
> insist on stereotyping voices. Probably the ridiculous shows on the  
> Travel & Sci Fi Channels and superstitious religious
> dogma.
> 
> There are many dimensions and Multiverses around us. No one can judge  
> a voice based on it's sound,
> tone, or anything else. It's too bad the media can't simply report on  
> the incredibly fascinating
> research we are doing without wanting creepy drama.
> 
> w.
> On Dec 2, 2008, at 6:38 PM, itcdeadpeople wrote:
> 
> > For whom do you write? Where can we read some of your previously
> > published material?? Based on your question, I'm assuming you aren't
> > looking to do the field of EVP/ITC or other paranormal research any
> > favors. What is your intention???
> >
> > How about focusing on something positive? That would be a nice change
> > of pace from the media. I don't think you'll find anyone here that is
> > willing to help perpetuate the negative stereotypical views on our
> > research or other nonsense that is a distraction from the fact that
> > there are valuable EVP/ITC advances taking place.
> >
> > Margaret
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "dmikolay" <dmikolay@> wrote:
> > >
> > > Anyone ever get an elemental, demon, or otherwise "inhuman" voice?
> > Anyone hear from
> > > someone with a dire warning? Anything else otherwise weird? I am a
> > journalist and would
> > > LOVE to interview you about it!
> > >
> >
> >
> >
>
